study_plan_entry.title: Thin films: fundamentals, structure and properties

free_text.Learning outcomes: The aims of the CCMX 2011 Winter School "Thin Films: Fundamentals, Structure and Properties" are:[br/][li] Cover important scientific aspects relating to thin films: nucleation, epitaxy, wettability, morphology, texture, constrained structures, adhesion, diffusion, and physical properties.[br/][li] Provide the participants with a skill set applicable to their research projects and future careers.[br/][li] Facilitate sustainable networking among the participants with group exercises/presentations and social activities.[br/]
free_text.Content: I. Nucleation and growth of thin films by Prof. Patrik Hoffmann (Empa/EPFL) - 4x50 min[br/]Group exercises & presentations on the topic of the day - 3 groups of participants; tutor Prof. Patrik Hoffmann - 3x50min[br/][br/]II. Film structure by Prof. Alex Dommann (CSEM) - 4x50 min[br/][br/]III. Mechanical properties of thin films by Prof. Alex Dommann (CSEM) - 4x50 min[br/]Group exercises & presentations on the topic of this day and day before - 3 groups of participants; tutor Prof. Alex Dommann - 3x50 min[br/][br/]IV. Physical properties of thin films by Prof. Paul Muralt (EPFL) - 4x50 min[br/]Group exercises & presentations on the topic of the day - 3 groups of participants; tutor Prof. Paul Muralt - 3x50 min[br/][br/]V. Emerging thin films technologies [br/]-  Pulsed laser deposition of oxides for energy applications by Dr. Thomas Lippert (PSI/ETHZ) - 1x50 min[br/]-  Laser-induced forward transfer of "sensitive" materials by Dr. Thomas Lippert (PSI/ETHZ) - 1x50 min[br/]-  Synthesis of nanowires and related heterostructures by molecular beam epitaxy by Prof. Anna Fontcuberta I Morral (EPFL) - 2x50 min[br/]
free_text.Note: Please note that the hours under "Total hours per instructor" have been calculated using 50-minute periods instead of 45. [br/]Total lecture/exercise time is therefore 1450 minutes corresponding to 32 periods of 45 minutes (22 mornings + 10 evening).[br/]The participants will need 8 periods to prepare the exercise/presentation before the course begins. The written exam will be organized at EPFL on the week of 7 February at EPFL (16 periods of self-study).[br/]The Winter School will take place in Les Diablerets.[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Master in materials sciences, physics or chemistry
